Yesterday @stevenmnuchin1 & I hosted a roundtable discussion with community bank leaders, including @VistaBank’s @johndsteinmetz. Together we discussed regulatory relief for #SmallBiz owners & ways to get our economy back on track to solve our nation’s economic crisis.

Public health officials & assisted living residents & their families need to know about COVID-19 cases & fatalities. @RepMaloney, @SenMarkey & I have a new bill to enact strict data collection and reporting requirements for assisted living centers. https://www.warren.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/warren-maloney-markey-release-findings-from-first-comprehensive-survey-of-covid-19-in-assisted-living-facilities-and-introduce-assisted-living-facility-coronavirus-reporting-act

My report with @RepMaloney & @SenMarkey found:
❌ 24% of assisted living facilities had at least 1 COVID-19 case. 8% had 10+ cases
❌ 43% of infected residents were hospitalized. 31% died.

That means about 7,000+ assisted living residents may have died from COVID-19 as of 5/31.

Assisted living centers have similar COVID-19 risks as nursing homes but not the same regulations & reporting requirements. We investigated assisted living operators & found alarming infection & fatality rates. Congress must require this data collection. https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/covid-19-killed-7000-assisted-living-congressional-report/story?id=71560689

56 years ago today the Civil Rights Act of 1964 was signed making it unlawful to discriminate against any individual because of their race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. We must continue building on this important piece of legislation—we still have so far to go.

We will beat this virus by listening to what the public health professionals are telling us: wear a mask, practice physical distancing, wash your hands. Save your life and the lives of the people who you love. We can do this.
